title: Bake Off Star Says Baking Cakes Is Hard Work
summary: Aaron Mountford-Myles was a runner-up on The Great British Bake Off, a TV show where people bake tasty treats. He says being on the show was not easy and involved a lot of stress and preparation. Even though he is a baker, he does not like making cakes. Many people now ask him to bake cakes after seeing him on TV, which he finds funny. He enjoyed meeting new fans and learning from the judges. Aaron encourages others to try Bake Off but warns it is hard work and not just fun baking.

background_read: The Great British Bake Off is a popular British TV competition where amateur bakers make cakes, bread, and other baked goods. Contestants face challenges each week, and judges decide who stays or leaves. It is known for its friendly atmosphere but can be stressful. Many people watch it for fun and to learn baking tips. Aaron was a contestant who almost won but came second, showing that even experts find it tough.
Article_Structure: WHO: Aaron Mountford-Myles, a runner-up on The Great British Bake Off.
WHAT: He talks about his experience on the show and how he hates making cakes even though he is a baker.
WHERE: On BBC Radio Stoke and in the Bake Off tent in the UK.
WHY: To share that Bake Off is challenging and not as easy as it looks, and to encourage others while being honest about his feelings.

perspectives.description: He finds baking cakes stressful and dislikes it, but values the experience and learning from judges.
